intro: This document serves as the Product User Manual (PUM) for the Copernicus Land Monitoring Service (CLMS) Urban Atlas Building Block Height Model (UA BBHM) 2012. It provides a comprehensive guide to the UA BBHM product, detailing its purpose, scope, methodology, and potential applications. Focusing on the technical aspects of the dataset, the manual explains how harmonised building height data for 870 cities and urban centres across the EEA38 region was generated from very high-resolution (VHR) imagery, outlining data characteristics, quality assurance procedures, and appropriate use cases for urban analysis and policy development.
